verses.verse: The threshing floors shall be full of wheat, And the vats shall overflow with new wine and oil.
“So I will restore to you the years (Joel 1:4-7; 2:2-11) that the swarming locust has eaten, The crawling locust, The consuming locust, And the chewing locust, My great army which I sent among you.

You shall (Lev. 26:5; Deut. 11:15; Is. 62:9) eat in plenty and be satisfied, And praise the name of the LORD your God, Who has dealt wondrously with you; And My people shall never be put to (Is. 45:17) shame.
Then you shall know that I am (Lev. 26:11, 12; (Joel 3:17, 21)) in the midst of Israel: ((Is. 45:5, 6)) I am the LORD your God And there is no other. My people shall never be put to shame.

God’s Spirit Poured Out“And (Ezek. 39:29; Acts 2:17-21) it shall come to pass afterward That (Zech. 12:10) I will pour out My Spirit on all flesh; (Is. 54:13) Your sons and your (Acts 21:9) daughters shall prophesy, Your old men shall dream dreams, Your young men shall see visions.
And also on My ((1 Cor. 12:13; Gal. 3:28)) menservants and on My maidservants I will pour out My Spirit in those days.
“And (Matt. 24:29; Mark 13:24, 25; Luke 21:11, 25, 26; Acts 2:19) I will show wonders in the heavens and in the earth: Blood and fire and pillars of smoke.

(Is. 13:9, 10; 34:4; Joel 2:10; 3:15; Matt. 24:29; Mark 13:24; Luke 21:25; Acts 2:20; Rev. 6:12, 13) The sun shall be turned into darkness, And the moon into blood, (Is. 13:9; Zeph. 1:14-16; (Mal. 4:1, 5, 6)) Before the coming of the great and awesome day of the LORD.

And it shall come to pass That (Jer. 33:3; Acts 2:21; Rom. 10:13) whoever calls on the name of the LORD Shall be saved. For (Is. 46:13; (Rom. 11:26)) in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be deliverance, As the LORD has said, Among (Is. 11:11; Jer. 31:7; (Mic. 4:7); Rom. 9:27) the remnant whom the LORD calls.
God Judges the Nations “For behold, (Jer. 30:3; Ezek. 38:14) in those days and at that time, When I bring back the captives of Judah and Jerusalem,

(Is. 66:18; Mic. 4:12; Zech. 14:2) I will also gather all nations, And bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat; And I (Is. 66:16; Jer. 25:31; Ezek. 38:22) will enter into judgment with them there On account of My people, My heritage Israel, Whom they have scattered among the nations; They have also divided up My land.
They have (Obad. 11; Nah. 3:10) cast lots for My people, Have given a boy as payment for a harlot, And sold a girl for wine, that they may drink.

“Indeed, what have you to do with Me, (Is. 14:29-31; Jer. 47:1-7; Ezek. 25:15-17; Amos 1:6-8; Zech. 9:5-7) O Tyre and Sidon, and all the coasts of Philistia? Will you retaliate against Me? But if you retaliate against Me, Swiftly and speedily I will return your retaliation upon your own head;
Because you have taken My silver and My gold, And have carried into your temples My prized possessions.
Also the people of Judah and the people of Jerusalem You have sold to the Greeks, That you may remove them far from their borders.
“Behold, (Is. 43:5, 6; Jer. 23:8; Zech. 9:13) I will raise them Out of the place to which you have sold them, And will return your retaliation upon your own head.
I will sell your sons and your daughters Into the hand of the people of Judah, And they will sell them to the (Ezek. 23:42) Sabeans, To a people (Jer. 6:20) far off; For the LORD has spoken.”
(Jer. 6:4; Ezek. 38:7; Mic. 3:5) Proclaim this among the nations: “Prepare for war! Wake up the mighty men, Let all the men of war draw near, Let them come up.
((Is. 2:4; Mic. 4:3)) Beat your plowshares into swords And your pruning hooks into spears; (Zech. 12:8) Let the weak say, ‘I am strong.’ ”
Assemble and come, all you nations, And gather together all around. Cause (Ps. 103:20; Is. 13:3) Your mighty ones to go down there, O LORD.
“Let the nations be wakened, and come up to the Valley of Jehoshaphat; For there I will sit to ((Ps. 96:13); Is. 2:4) judge all the surrounding nations.
